result.execSummary:
The defendant San Hua J Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Total length of sentence in WSP consecutive to any other sentence is four (4) years; 2 years initial confinement; 2 years extended supervision. The defendant IS eligible for the CIP & WSAP.
Consecutive to: TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE
to take effect upon reinstatement of revoked license
Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and driver Safety Plan signed and filed.

miscConds.notes:
Fine of $600.00 plus all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge. Due by the end of probation/extended supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
If revoked, DOC to collect from 25% of prison funds.

*Job and vocational training
*Seek and maintain employment

No driving while on medication
No controlled substance other than those legally prescribed for defendant by a duly licensed physician and only as long as deemed necessary for defendasnt's physical or mental health.

urine screens
CONDITIONS to apply to extended supervision (if revoked)
The court advised deendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms; further advised of voting ineligibility.
AODA assessment and treatment.  Urine screens.

records.addlTxt:
Correction as to Sentencing Entry of 07/10/2014:
6 months condition time with Huber for work CONSECUTIVE
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant San Hua J Robinson in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant San Hua J Robinson in custody.  Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.
Branch 20 in trial.  Case put over to 7/10/14 at 1:30 p.m.
Due to lateness in the hour, Court ordered case continued for plea and sentencing.

Attorney Valeria L Taylor in court, defendant San Hua J Robinson not in court, in custody.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared on behalf of Jay R. Pucek for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel received an offer from another ADA; requested another date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Valeria L Taylor in court, defendant San Hua J Robinson not in court, in custody.  Jay R Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Valeria L Taylor in court, defendant San Hua J Robinson not in court, in custody.  Jay R Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counser requested another scheduling date to go over offer with her client.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court via telephone, defendant San Hua J Robinson not in court, in custody.  Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel needs an offer.  Case is continued before Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 03-27-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant San Hua J Robinson in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant San Hua J Robinson in custody.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has three cases before the court.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.
Clerk:  jms

Filed, Notice of Motion and Motion to Reduce Bail.

Notice Of Motion And Motion To Reduce Bail

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by SCRAM, drug tests and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant San Hua J Robinson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant San Hua J Robinson in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
